name: Pretty, silent and blessed by evil
author: Ketsu

posts.author: Ketsu
posts.content:
Good day, sir! I've been looking for some evil elf kin. alright:
1) 1-40 PvM
2) Str-based or even Cha-based and Katana to slashing
3) Rog/Sd/Bg... any ideas for that combo

The main concept is sneaking, hips, UMD and divine might. It would be great if he/she can soloing every encounters. Excuse me if i posted it in wrong sub-forum. Thank you all ^^

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hello Ketsu!
Let me just assure you, you are not in the wrong forum.

First, let me get this right. You want an elf, a sneaker with HIPS that can solo.
You want Katana and strength based, but you also want DM and some charisma
And you want to build with Rogue, Shadowdancer and Blackguard.

Basically this is a "Fighter/Rogue" type build. But you complicate things a little bit with Divine Might and Charisma. You also want two classes in there that both need 2 feats to qualify; Dodge and Mobility for SD and Power attack and Cleave for BG. There is a small synergy since you also need Power attack for Divine might, but the build will be very feat starved, especially since you also want an exotic weapon.
It is possible though. Your pre epic feats will be Dodge, Mobility, Power attack, Cleave, Weapon proficiency exotic, Weapon focus Katana and Divine Might. And that is all you get.

Starting out with a strength based build, you cannot afford a high dexterity. Even if you max out the stealth skills, they will not be impressive until you can afford some epic skill focus feats to boost them. Stealth will even be worse once you get access to, and start using heavy armor from Blackguard. But the most difficult part will be your low AC during the first levels due to the low dexterity and only access to light armor.

The best (pre epic) BAB you can get with these classes is +17. It is possible to get a final strength of 32 with an AB of 42 and still get a Charisma of 16, but then either your Constitution will suffer with consequently low hitpoints, or your Intelligence with less skills.

So you are in a squeeze with a build like this. It can be done, but it will never be great. It will be hard to level up early on, but it can be fairly all right later if you can live with the shortcomings. What you finally get is a good amount of Sneak damage and consistent strength based damage.  The divine damage is hard to resist and the saves are better than the average Fighter/Rogue. HIPS will probably save your life more than once, once you get it.
Sometimes I play builds like this just for the challenge of it, but I don't recommend it to anybody.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I was just about to answer that but Mick did that for me.
Basically, the gist of this is that your build, although at the end might sound quite powerful with 17d6 sneak attack, epic vrock, katana, 32 strength, crippling strike, divine might, umd & HiPS, it will get until your 24th level to actually get the full functionality out of it & it will never be great (compared to a similar optimized build). Going with human & longsword (or another martial weapon) will make this slightly more tolerable.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Genuine question, and recognizing the lack of UMD, might Monk be better placed than Rogue here? Free Cleave and IKD, and you could go either kama or fist for Monk APR. Natural AC bumps and speed. And you get to keep Evasion and Imp Evasion, as well as stealth skills, Tumble and better saves. Admittedly, you'd be fighting in robes and sneaks would be somewhat buggered (technical term), but I just wondered...

Cheers

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content: The ac hit would be huge unless he went dex based, which is against the request of this build...of course we don't even have an example to discuss :)

posts.author: Ketsu
posts.content:
Thanks to reply guys, especially Mick. That deep analysis just pushed me to the ground. I have some thoughts about optimizing. Pls take a look:
1) swap str to dex. It could take free way to AC and ranged weapon
2) light weapon instead of katana
Also, at the other hand i can drop rog and pick some more synergycal class, but i can't even imagine fun gameplay without stealth

P. S. Idea of Cha-based sneaker still live in my head. Sorry Stag, i played too many times with kamas :)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
A few idle musings, if I may...

Going Dex-based will indeed help AC (assuming you won't be going heavy armour), but it won't help with the feat starvation - you'll simply be replacing Exotic Weapon Proficiency for Weapon Finesse (presumably rapier if going for elf). And you'll be more reliant on sneak attacks, or your damage will be pretty sucky (another technical term).

If you wanted to replace Rogue and maintain Uncanny Dodge (much more important in a Dex build, obvs) before SD2 kicks in, Barbarian is your only option, 'cause you can't take 3 prestige classes. Of course, there are pluses and minuses to Barb over Rogue. You get full BAB, Rage, 10% extra speed, and martial weapons, but you lose access to UMD, total number of skill points, stealth and Tumble (manageable once you get SD), reliance on BG for sneaks, and no Epic Dodge unless you take at least 10 levels of SD.

So I'm not sure whether a change to a Dex focus - with or without Rogue - would be beneficial or not. Sorry to play the party-pooper!

Cheers

posts.author: Ketsu
posts.content:
That's a really good point. I just try to realize DM at all. I can drop SD for sure and get 2 free feats, then i will pick DS and maybe KD. There is no hips anymore but i still can use Darkness for to land sneaks.
Another option is Rog/Bg3/Assassin but then i need a lot of Dex and decent Int + Cha...

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Okay, with a bit more flexibility built in and without sacrificing the concept completely, have you seen Valerfor's Codename Stingray ? It keeps the spirit of a charming stealther, but is a Str build, so we don't need to worry about UD so much. I'm not saying it's your ideal, but it's definitely worth a look.

posts.author: Ketsu
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote: Okay, with a bit more flexibility built in and without sacrificing the concept completely, have you seen Valerfor's Codename Stingray ? It keeps the spirit of a charming stealther, but is a Str build, so we don't need to worry about UD so much. I'm not saying it's your ideal, but it's definitely worth a look.

Bard/RDD is always good, work as a clock. I played assassin king one time and it is quite powerful build at all stages, but that stealth is too late 'cause I play mostly modules with slow exp progression which mean 1 week for first stealth mission or something like this xD

When you are ninja in your soul and you need to just walks and hits the faces over and over again just to get access to normal ninja things... meh

P. S. Excuse me for that childish crying. Facehitting looking a bit boring for me. Scouting, tactical planning, green carpets and sudden strikes is all about my playstyle.

posts.content:

You're welcome Ketsu

Also, at the other hand i can drop rog and pick some more synergycal class, but i can't even imagine fun gameplay without stealth

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Now we are talking!

Have you played this through Aielund Mick? I recall you took some Assassin for a ride there but I don't remember which one.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: Now we are talking!

Have you played this through Aielund Mick? I recall you took some Assassin for a ride there but I don't remember which one.
No, not this one. But I took the Kama Shinobi all the way through.

posts.author: Ketsu
posts.content:
Well, I just ended with SoU for test. Not so easy to play alone at the start but after getting DA and HiPS... I believe it will be
the "killtrain" for Aielund :)

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Ketsu wrote: Well, I just ended with SoU for test. Not so easy to play alone at the start but after getting DA and HiPS... I believe it will be
the "killtrain" for Aielund :)
That kind of assassins often are "slow starters", but once you get HIPS and the DA starts piling up, most things vanish before your blades. And by all means, play alone as a stalker, so you can trigger the paralysis on flat footed enemies. Soloing Aielund with an assassin like this is not too hard, as long as you know what you're doing.
